title: Fragment, 5th–6th century
medium:
Medium: linen warp; wool and linen weft
Technique: two pieces sewn together; the top appliquéd to the bottom. Bottom fabric plain weave with bands of weft loops.  Top square of tapestry (plain weave with slits, wrapped warps and slanted wefts).
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 21 x 17.8 cm (8 1/4 in. x 7 in.)
description: Central square with four figures carrying animals and objects in brown, red, green and yellow, framed by a deep border of loops.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 5th–6th century.
5th–6th century. Medium: linen warp; wool and linen weft
Technique: two pieces sewn together; the top appliquéd to the bottom. Bottom fabric plain weave with bands of weft loops.  Top square of tapestry (plain weave with slits, wrapped warps and slanted wefts).. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-453.
